Module
mvau_stream_tb_v2.​sv (testbench)

Author(s): Syed Asad Alam syed.as[xxx]ad.alam@tcd[xxx].ie

v3.0: Reads input data from a file and reads weights from a file Compares output of DUT with outputs from a file.This file lists a test bench for the matrix-vector activation streaming unit. This test bench is part of the regression test for MVAU stream unit.

It is part of the Xilinx FINN open source framework for implementing quantized neural networks on FPGAs

This material is based upon work supported, in part, by Science Foundation Ireland, www.sfi.ie under Grant No. 13/RC/2094 and, in part, by the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement Grant No.754489.

Parameters
CLK_PER

Clock cycle period

INIT_DLY=(CLK_PER*2)+1

Initial delay

RAND_DLY=21

Random delay to be used when needed

NO_IN_VEC = 100

Number of input vectors

ACT_MatrixW = OFMDim*OFMDim;

Input activation matrix height

ACT_MatrixH = (KDim*KDim*IFMCh)

Input activation matrix weight

TOTAL_OUTPUTS = MatrixH*ACT_MatrixW

Total number of elements in the output matrix

Signals
aresetn

Asynchronous active low reset

rready

Input signal to DUT indicating that successor logic is ready to consume data

wready

Output signal from DUT indicating to the predecessor logic should start sending data

wmem_wready

Output signal from DUT indicating to the predecessor weight stream logic should start sending weights

in_v

Input valid

in_wgt_v

Weight stream valid signal

weights

The weight matrix of dimensions (MatrixW/SIMD)*(MatrixH/PE) x MatrixH of word length TW x SIMD

in_wgt_packed

Input weight stream packed Dimension: PE*TW*SIMD

in_wgt_um

Input weight stream extracting weights from weight matrix Dimension: PE, word length: TW*SIMD

in_mat

Input activation matrix Dimension: ACT_MatrixH x ACT_MatrixW, word length: TSrcI

in_act

Input activation stream to DUT Dimension: SIMD, word length: TSrcI

mvau_beh

Output matrix holding output of behavioral simulation Dimension: MatrixH x ACT_MatrixW

out_v

Output valid signal

out

Output from DUT, word length: TO = PExTDstI

out_packed

Output signal from DUT where each element is divided into multiple elements as DUT produces a packed output of size PE x TDstI.  Dimension: PE, word length: TDstI

test_count

An integer to count for successful output matching

latency

An integer to count the total number of cycles taken to get all outputs

sim_start

A signal which indicates when simulation starts

do_comp

A signal which indicates the comparison is done, helps in debugging

Combinatorial Always Blocks
CLK_GEN

Generating clock using the CLK_PER as clock period

WGT_MAT_GEN

Always block for populating the weight matrix from a memory file

INP_ACT_MAT_GEN

Always block for populating the input activation matrix from a memory file

OUT_ACT_MAT_GEN

Always block for populating the output activation matrix from a memory file

Sequential Always Blocks
CALC_LATENCY

Always block for calculating the total run time of simulation in terms of clock cycles

Combinatorial Always Blocks
Input Ready
